definition: to talk to oneself/to think aloud/to soliloquize

sentences.english: "I could look in the encyclopedia, " she said to herself.
sentences.chinese: “我可以去查百科全书，”姗姗自言自语道。

sentences.english: A common testing methodology is to use the think-aloud protocol.
sentences.chinese: 一个通常使用的方法是自言自语条约。

sentences.english: Great genes, I muttered to myself.
sentences.chinese: 我不禁喃喃自语，果然是强大的基因。

sentences.english: Just don't talk to yourself out loud and in front of the interviewer...
sentences.chinese: 只是你自言自语的时候不要在面试官前太大声。

sentences.english: "Stupid guy," I muttered to myself, switching off the television.
sentences.chinese: “蠢东西，”我自言自语地咕哝道，关掉了电视。

sentences.english: She went on to herself. `I thought he wished it.
sentences.chinese: 她自言自语地往下说，“我以为他是愿意的。

sentences.english: The old woman seemed to speak to herself, or appearing to talk to me and other seated people.
sentences.chinese: 老人像是自言自语，又像说给我和在坐的人们。

sentences.english: In fact, soliloquize to practice oral English is also one of the effective methods.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，自言自语亦是练习口语的有效的方法之一。

sentences.english: I said to myself. “I guess I better cancel my dinner plans.
sentences.chinese: 我自言自语道，“我想我还是取消晚餐计划好了。

sentences.english: The boy is prattling happily in his cot.
sentences.chinese: 那幼儿在小床上呀呀自语，快活得很。

sentences.english: "Wow, " she said, "today I get to wear my hair in a pony tail.
sentences.chinese: 她自语道，“今天我可以梳个马尾头了。”

sentences.english: This man was engaged in a long soliloquy in his room.
sentences.chinese: 这个人长时间在自己的房间内自言自语。

sentences.english: Sometime what he mutters sounds nothing and elusive.
sentences.chinese: 有时候他好像喃喃自语，内容空洞而不著边际。

sentences.english: The week mutters after the gentleman, orotund cheap oneself have to can only hear to pure.
sentences.chinese: 周继君喃喃自语着，声音低得只有自己能听清。

sentences.english: Through the whole night, and far into the morning, we heard him groaning and murmuring to himself.
sentences.chinese: 一整夜，直到早上我们听见他呻吟自语。

definition: to talk to oneself/to think aloud/to soliloquize
